khaki noun
(CLOTHES)
[ U ] military-style clothes made of yellowish-brown or greenish-brown cloth: Some were in khaki and some in white navy uniforms. He was surrounded by armed guards wearing khaki. khakis [ plural ]
mainly US loose cotton trousers, usually of a light brown colour: He was dressed in khakis and a T-shirt. At her private school, kids are required to wear khakis and polo shirts. Loafers can be paired with casual pieces like jeans, short skirts and khakis. Synonym
chinos
military-style clothes made of yellowish-brown or greenish-brown cloth: The men look like soldiers, in khakis and caps. He owned civilian clothes, but when he appeared in public he always wore crisply pressed military khakis.
